summary:
I am a trustworthy, ambitious and hardworking finance professional with over 7 years of post-qualified experience and a strong foundation of advanced financial reporting and planning skills. I have built this experience across varied roles in both practice and blue-chip industry environments. I am also adept in partnering with commercial managers to influence business growth decisions, whilst my exceptional communication skills and personable character enable me to collaborate effectively with a broad range of internal stakeholders and clients. 

Key achievements
•	In a commercial business partnering role, identified and implemented profit improvement plans for poorly performing insurance brokers. 7 out of 8 identified brokers turned around into profitability the next year.
•	Provided financial insight and advice on financial performance to account managers which enabled constructive negotiations resulting in two of AXA’s largest partners turning a profit for the first time in 3&4 years respectively in 2021.
•	Partnering with stakeholder across the business including the FD, cost centre managers and account managers, I consistently delivered clear and accurate cost budgets and insightful variance analysis over multiple periods. 
•	In my role as an expense controller I oversaw the re-design, implementation and roll-out of a new payroll process after a breach which is still in place today.
•	Working for an international company in recent years, I have developed close relationships and understandings with colleagues around the world, including in France, India and Japan. 
•	Highly motivated to help others succeed. I recently managed and mentored a junior team member by identifying his areas of expertise and development focus, subsequently earning him promotion to a management role.
•	Fellow of the ACCA and achieved a first-class honours degree and counselling diploma, successfully balancing studying and workplace commitments.
•	I am a trained Mental Health First Aider and have led workshops both in person and online during the pandemic after producing special virtual training materials.

profile_positions.description:
I spent over 6 years at Scrutton Bland working in the Business Services Department. My main duties included:
•	High degree of direct client contact ranging from small sole traders to larger limited companies and groups up to £20M turnover and across diverse sectors such as manufacturing, farming, haulage and construction.
•	Preparation of year end accounts, including bank reconciliation, control account reconciliation, fixed asset registers etc.
•	Monthly and quarterly management accounts preparation for clients.
•	Assisting in client audits, both in house and at client premises. 
•	Book-keeping, preparation and filing of VAT returns and preparation of corporate tax returns. 
•	Supervision and management of junior members of staff.
For the last 15 months I was seconded part-time to a client in the manufacturing sector after their Financial Director was made redundant. In this role I prepared Management Accounts for the Managing Director, Chairman and Bank. I also prepared Financial Statements and supporting schedules for the yearly Audit, as well as quarterly VAT returns. During this period I had responsibility for three members of the company’s Finance Team.
